data.title: Raimundo Calcagno
data.text: Raimundo Calcagno, popularly known as Calki, (29 October 1906 â 4 September 1982) was an Argentine film critic, journalist, and screenwriter. He started writing reviews in El Mundo in the 1930s.[1][2] In 1943 he wrote the script for Luis BayÃ³n Herrera's La piel de zapa,[3] and also collaborated in writing the script for RomÃ¡n ViÃ±oly Barreto's Con el sudor de tu frente (1949) and Manuel AntÃ­n's Intimidad de los parques (1965).
